title: 112_s1656
content: The "Hardship Outlays to protect Mortgagee Equity (HOME) Act" allows for a waiver of tax on early distributions from certain retirement plans for mortgage payments related to a primary residence. The "Hardship Outlays to protect Mortgagee Equity (HOME) Act" amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow distributions for principal residence mortgage payments from retirement plans without tax penalties. The "Hardship Outlays to protect Mortgagee Equity (HOME) Act" allows distributions for principal residence mortgage payments from retirement plans without tax penalties. Qualified principal residence mortgage payment distributions must be used within 120 days for qualified mortgage costs. The "Hardship Outlays to protect Mortgagee Equity (HOME) Act" allows qualified individuals to receive aggregate lifetime dollar limitations for principal residence mortgage payment distributions from retirement plans without tax penalties. The total amount cannot exceed $50,000 minus previous distributions. The "Hardship Outlays to protect Mortgagee Equity (HOME) Act" permits qualified individuals to receive lifetime dollar limitations for mortgage payment distributions from retirement plans. The distributions cannot exceed one-half of the individual's accrued benefit under the plan. Qualified mortgage costs include amounts paid towards acquisition indebtedness, with certain limitations. The "Hardship Outlays to protect Mortgagee Equity (HOME) Act" allows qualified individuals to receive lifetime dollar limitations for mortgage payment distributions from retirement plans. Amendments are made to the tax code regarding qualified principal residence mortgage payment distributions. Amendments to the tax code allow for changes in qualified principal residence mortgage payment distributions, with an effective date for distributions in taxable years after the enactment of the Act.
